Acknowledgements

May 1st, 2025

"If I have seen further, it is by standing on the shoulders of giants."

Isaac Newton


The main contribution of the first writer to PTWE is the audacity to propose NLNM combat and the effort put in to present it in written form. This effort and any success gained by the ideas in it would not be possible without God's help, divine guidance and inspiration.


This blog is only possible because of the availability of information that access to the contemporary Internet provides. A large multitude of sources was used to compile the information presented here, ranging from news articles and agency status reports to video lectures, analytical papers. News aggregators like Google News were also very helpful in finding articles with wide ranging points of view and compiled for readers from various countries. Google Translate was extremely helpful in translating articles written in a multitude of languages.

While it is often neither fully objective nor accurate in the matters of history, Wikipedia is nonetheless a great source of historical information that often presents the point of view of the country that is being discussed. It was the primary source of information for the historical research on most of the countries so far mentioned in the blog.

Also a multitude of online channels were used to understand the current state of the international situation. Most prominent once that presently come to mind are:

Радио Аврора

CRUXNews

CaspianReport

and countless others

Most of the sources used as the informational basis for this blog present a particular point of view that favors a given grouping of interests. A geographical and political range of sources was used to gain a clearer understanding of the current state of the international situation.

The most prominent individuals whose perspective and analysis were used as the basis for understanding the present situation are:

Leonid Hazin

Abhijit Chavda

and many others

The general framework of the important factors for a given nation is attributed to Abhijit Chavda.

Article references
